column4: i've installed ubuntu 9.10 now, from windows using wubi. i reboot and completed the installation. but when i'm going to start linux, it stops at grub and i dont know how to boot linux
ok well just remove Wubi then, real partitions are better in the long run :)
also Wubi can go odd on people
also more people know how to get hold of data and such, from real partitions, rather than a Wubi install
first remove Wubi
you also need to download the Live CD  ISO  which is also used for install
you can remove Wubi like a normal Windows program
the contents of the ISO, but first it's a good idea to check your ISO to make sure you have a good one
yes
ok so you already have an ISO for Ubuntu?
right, but that's after you installed it using Wubi?
you were in Windows put your CD in and used Wubi to install?
oh ok, well there is a much easier way to get the Wubi installer
however you got the ISO ok good,  you need to burn the contents to a CD, so you can install a proper install,  but before you do that, you should remove Wubi
hmm
what about a data DVD?
this is how to install Ubuntu  the easy and good way, from a CD or DVD

You can also install from a USB Flash stick if you have one big enough and that, but those can be a bit difficult to make or something,   Plus there's that netinstall which isn't really for new users.
don't use Wubi
no CD's and no DVD's ok
you need to make "real partitions" on your hard disk,  for a proper install of Ubuntu
Wubi does not do that for you,  a Wubi install that works can be converted to real partitions though
